comment: Like others said, easy A. graded by 7 quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 final. All of which are open note, open book, no lockdown browser, and no webcam.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Such a good professor, honestly. You only have 7 Homeworks, a midterm, and a final exam. Attendance was never mandatory, and he set the class up so that you could complete everything from home. No webcam or lockdown browser for tests or quizzes. This class is such an easy A. Take him!!!

He is very funny and smart. Attendance is not mandatory but go to class if you really want to learn. 7 Quizzes during semester, and one midterm and final. They are taken at home, no lockdown. Use resources. No homework. It's really easy to pass, up to you if you want to LEARN tho. He has a slight accent but easy to understand. Genuinely very funny.

Was one of the smartest teachers I have ever had in my life like genius level. Class is about economics, but he would relate subjects to everything from ancient history to physics. I looked forward to going to his class and just listening to him talk. He was an awesome teacher, and was very funny. I would highly recommend taking his classes.

Honestly this class was a free A. Please show up to his lectures, it made me sad seeing only 9 of us show up out of 94... There are 7 online quizzes and a midterm and final. ALL of them are openbook. Go to his lectures, he's hilarious.
Lectures are interesting, all assignments are online, and this class is an easy A.
I thought he was hilarious and his lectures were extremely informative! I learned a ton in his class and it was pretty easy...the tests follow along with the lectures and book.

All assignments were online. He uses Excel a lot. Attendance is not mandatory but can be helpful because he is very good at answering any questions you might have. But if you have no questions about the material, then attendance is not needed. He does waste a lot of class time going off on politics and economics.

Don't even show up if you don't think the class will benefit you at all. Easiest A ever, everything can be found online, but not sure it was even a Business Stat class because everything was pretty much basic stat except for him playing on excel the entire class and going off on political rants. If you don't mind not learning anything then take him

Professor Melnik made it very clear throughout the whole semester that he hated teaching Business Statistics and it showed. He frequently expressed his distaste for the class he was teaching and made multiple inappropriate comments to students every class, mostly directed towards the girls in attendance and about politics. Easy A but not worth it.
Everything is open book without proctoring. Take this class if you are looking for an easy A

Very interesting person: while showing up for class isn't necessary, you really should! He has very respectable thoughts on many different things and enjoys talking to class members, even if it's not strictly economical - such as discussion of AI, etc. His lectures are comprehensive, but be warned: the lecture notes are full of omissions.

One of my favorite Econ professors I have ever taken. He is very funny and is very good at explaining and making concepts simple. All quizzes and exam are open book.  you do not have to attend class, but he makes you laugh so you should still go. PASSING THIS CLASS IS EASY. MUST TAKE
easy easy easy
Easy class and clear instructions and amazing lectures

Overall, really nice professor. Attendance is not mandatory, all the quizzes and lectures are posted online. You just need to allocate time to answer them. 7 quizzes, 1 midterm taken from the first 4 quizzes, 1 final taken from the 7 quizzes.
I love this guy. There was only 10 assignments the entire semester, and I still feel like I learned a ton.

I took this professor over the summer and it was a pretty straightforward class. His lectures contained all the answers for the homework/tests. The lectures were pretty heavy and contained a lot of information. Tests were open notes and timed. He does answer emails quickly and if you need help, he's there to help.
He provided lectures for quizzes. Quizzes were assigned every other week or so. No lockdown browser. Very simple class. Study the material, pass the class with a an A. Very easy, highly recommend.

Easiest econ class I have ever taken. Every assessment is online and the answers are all either in the powerpoints or on other websites. Attendance is optional. I showed up only once in the whole semester and still finished with a high A. Just be aware of deadlines.

Easiest class of your college career. Basically read the Lecture PowerPoints and you will do amazing. Dont bother with the text book. Also attendance doesnt matter but if you want to get some value out of your tuition go to hear his rants. EASY A!!

Too many assignments... The assignments are very difficult and require a lot of time to complete. Yes, they are online in D2L, but you will need to read the text, follow the lectures, and understand everything to pass the class. There are absolutely no extra credit possibilities or make-ups. I am a junior and this was the toughest class so far.

This was probably the easiest class I've ever taken at KSU. It wasn't a whole bunch of busy work and very straight forward. He did not require attendance which was nice considering the pandemic. When I did attend his lectures though it seemed like he was just there to rant and talk about how unimportant microeconomics was.

comment: Prof walked in on the first day and had no idea what class he was supposed to be teaching. Asked the students for the name of the prof because he didn't know if it was him. Encouraged us not to come to class because he parked far away and didn't want to come to class. Attendance clearly not mandatory. Easy A, didn't learn anything.

Only gave him 4 stars because he doesnt know how to stay on track with lectures. He post everything you need to pass on D2L, hw every two weeks and a midterm and final. All open note. Dont buy the book, he goes off his uploaded lectures/PowerPoints on D2L. Take him for an easy A

comment: Super easy class!!! Everything is open note, just a quiz for every module + midterm and final. Everything is set up super clearly. LOVED him

Take this teacher if you aren't as good at ECON!! Pretty easy!! Everything is online, prerecorded lectures, open-note for EVERYTHING, attendance is not mandatory, HW is like every two weeks, 7 homeworks, 2 tests, and approachable/cool guy! Was an amazing choice if you need to take Econ for required classes. Attendance was not mandatory and there was homework every two weeks with a midterm and final about 30 questions, online and open note. He is very willing to extend homework if you email him and you genuinely try in the class. LOVED HIM!

Do the work and youll be fine. Homework due every two weeks. One midterm and one final. You dont have to go to class at all and advise you not to. He doesnt stay on track. DO NOT BUY the textbook, all assignments are based on PowerPoints and module guidelines that he post to D2L. Take the course, easy A.

comment: Easiest class I've ever taken. Take notes on the power points, take quizzes, and you pass. In-class lectures can get off topic so I have only been to a handful the entire semester. Regardless of lack of attendance, I have a very high B. Again, EASIEST class ever.

This was my first online class, and first college class in over 10 years, so I was extremely nervous starting. However, I really enjoyed this class and the professor was very straightforward in grading and the material reflected what appeared on the quizzes and tests. The homework really helps! Highly recommend this professor! :)

TAKE PROF MELNIK FOR ECON 3300. Coming from someone who absolutely sucks at statistics, this class was extremely easy from day one. 7 quizzes worth 40% of your grade and a midterm and a final worth 30% each. I would 100% take this class again.

For starters, Business Statistics is tough. Prof. Melnik removes all of the unnecessary stuff and explains it in a way that you can understand. He lets you use open notes/book and no lockdown browser to do your exams. You have 7 homework assignments, one midterm, and one final. He makes it as easy as you can expect for Statistics.

comment: There are only 9 assignments total. 7 homeworks that are 40% of your grade, and 2 tests that are 60%. The material is not easy, I recommend getting the book he wrote. comment: Easy A. Essentially an online class. Attendance isn't mandatory or necessary, but lectures are actually entertaining & he's a very funny professor. Everything (HW, quizzes, tests) is online, doesn't require Lockdown Browser/Webcam, and are open note. Literally if you have a pulse you can get an A in this class. Highly recommend, great guy!

40% of your grade are quizzes that are open note and not timed. However, they are quite difficult and the class avg for most of the quizzes was around 75-80. 1 midterm and 1 cumulative final. He curved the grades by A LOT which saved everyones grade. I would recommend him for an A but definitely was a bit of work.

(hw) is 40% of your grade and are difficult but as long as u use google and attempt the problems its doable. made a majority of b's and a's on them. The midterm and final are 30% each and hard but still very doable as long as u prepare before. He curved everyone at the end by A LOT of points. Very little communication. just try in the class its ez
You don't have to attend class, but he is entertaining and makes the class interesting. All the tests are online. His reviews before the test are extremely helpful. Highly recommend taking him.

(Saturday class) I found Melnik's lectures interesting and entertaining, which is a shame as you don't really need to attend class to get an A. If you're goal is to learn something I would recommend attending the lectures, if you just want the grade come for the test reviews and write down everything he says and you're guaranteed an A.
This is the worst teacher I have had in my academic career. His powerpoint are from 2013 and all he does is stutter and cough in the microphone.

Took his Saturday class. homework every week based on lecture. 2 exams and 1 final. if you don't go to class that one day a week you will have no idea what is going on. He makes jokes in class. Is Russian. never used the textbook, he does have a powerpoint but it is better to take notes on what he writes on the board. teaches you how to use excel.

comment: Great professor. Highly recommend

I took it online, there were 2 tests and about 7-8 HWs. HW is 40% of the grade, and the two tests were 60%.. He makes it very easy to pass as long as you do all of the HW and make decent grades on the test. For a hard subject, he is a good guy to take. He posts very thorough explanations on D2L.

Took this class online. Although there are no tutorials and you are pretty much on your own, he is a fair grader.  He curves the final grade based on the class average. As long as you do the work, you should get a good grade.

goes out of the topic  but he give good review before the test and all the 3 test online even the final!

comment: This is my second class with Professor Melnik and I think he is Awesome.  He takes a complicated course and makes it very easy to understand.  You will also  understand how statistics is used in the business world.   If you go to class AND pay attention you will do well.

Great professor. Very knowledgeable but more in real economics not statistics. Russian accent but bearable. There are only 2 exams all which are online. He also gives about 8-10 homework assignments-quizzes (online)which is 50% of your grade. Take him if you can. He may appear bad in the beginning but stick it out he isn't bad at all.
This teacher is a G. He is very informative and all test are online.
Graded homework assignments given every week. He is very thorough. Go to class and pay close attention, it will help GREATLY for homework assignments.  Would take him again!
Easy to pass, but highly recommend attending the class. Tests and homework assignments were online.

Melnik is a nationally recognized economistspeaker. Lectures are very unstructured and packed with real business examples of micro economics.  Attendance not reqd. Homework is VERY light & exams avg 20 questions. Grades on a curve, but beware, relatively few points total in course. Algebra and calculus proficiency helpful. He's also a physicist!

Took Econ 2 online and it wasn't nearly as fun though he was just as helpful and the course was just as easy. The narrated powerpoints give all the information needed for quizzes and exams so I didn't find the book necessary.

Excellent professor who knows his subject extremely well, good sense of humor too, though a 3 hour class is rough to sit through regardless. Book is only necessary for exams and probably not then if I had taken better notes, entire grade is 4 tests.

Very well informed. Attendance is not mandatory and the exams are online. Easy and enjoyable class I went even though not required to attend his lectures which are unorganized, sometimes off topic, but funny and informative.

I took him for Macroeconomics, and I made a B with not as much effort as I put into most other classes. Read the book to understand the concepts, and go to lecture to talk about the concepts. Basically you learn on your own, but you familiarize yourself with the materials through conversation in class.

very disorganized teacher. Has no power points, no assigments and goes all over the place. Exams are based on what hus talks about only and he often gets off the subject so its kind if hard to know what he focuses on ! Do not recommend him because he doesnt follow the book and just talks and talks and then gives an exam ! Run away
